required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Detection of Lung Cancer in Czech High-risk Asymptomatic Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: Early Detection of Lung Cancer in Czech High-risk Asymptomatic Individuals

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate and optimize entry criteria for the proposed programme for early detection of lung cancer in the Czech Republic.
An estimated 3200 high-risk (age 55-74 years, >30 pack-years) asymptomatic individuals will undergo baseline low-dose chest CT (LDCT) and a follow-up LDCT at 1 year. Patients with poor performance status (PS) 2-4, history of malignancy in the past 10 years, chest CT in the past 1 year, bodyweight >140kg will not be included.
The patients will fill out a questionnaire with basic data, including smoking history (pack-years), history of previous malignancy, CT imaging of the thorax, and will undergo spirometry.
Outcomes of the study include:
- optimization of entry criteria, optimization of timing of a follow-up LDCT and management of the patients, proposal of quality assurance indicators
- influence of screening on the stage of lung cancer at the time of the diagnosis and life-years lost
- cost-effectiveness of the screening program
- evaluation of the diagnostic yield for secondary findings (pulmonary fibrosis, cardiovascular risk)

primary_outcome.measure: The number of cancers detected at stage I
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of cancers diagnosed at a resectable stage (stage I) vs. non-resectable stage (II-IV) will be compared to the stage distribution in an unscreened population

secondary_outcome.measure: The cost per diagnosis at a resectable stage
secondary_outcome.description: The cost per diagnosis at a resectable stage will encompass the cost of low-dose CT (LDCT), follow-up LDCT, verification (PET/CT, tissue sampling, bronchoscopy).

other_outcome.description: The number, cost, and complications of secondary examinations generated by screening LDCT.
The number and types of secondary findings and their clinical relevance (potentially important vs. unimportant findings) will be reported.

arm_group.description: Single arm - all patients undergo low-dose CT (LDCT) examination of lungs

intervention.description: Follow-up low-dose CT, PET-CT, tissue sampling (transparietal biopsy, bronchoscopy, resection), contrast-enhanced CT of the thorax

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 55-74 years
- Smoking: >= 30 pack-years, smoker or ex-smoker <15 years
- Performance status (0-1) - can climb at least one floor without any difficulty or pause
Exclusion Criteria:
- Body weight above 140 kg
- Malignant disease within the last 10 years (except non-melanoma skin cancer).
- Chest CT less than one year ago
- Clinical signs suspicious of lung cancer (weight loss, new cough, hemoptysis)

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share individual participant data.
